name: GetZoomHostReport
description:
Retrieve Zoom host activity reports for a specified period.

Fetch detailed reports of Zoom hosts' activities over a specified date range within the last six months. It provides lists of active or inactive hosts, detailing meetings, participants, and meeting minutes. Applicable for users with a Pro or higher plan.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Start date of the report in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format. The date range for the report must be within one month.

value_schema.description: Start date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format. The date range defined by the `from` and `to` parameters should only be one month as the report includes only one month worth of data at once.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End date for the report in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format. Must be at most one month after the 'from' date.

parameters.name: host_activity_type
parameters.description: Specify 'active' for active hosts or 'inactive' for inactive hosts.

value_schema.description:
Active or inactive hosts.  
 `active` - Active hosts.   
 `inactive` - Inactive hosts.

parameters.name: record_count_per_api_call
parameters.description: Specify the number of records to return in each API call, controlling the data amount per request.

value_schema.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: current_page_number
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve for the host activity report.

value_schema.description: The page number of the current page in the returned records.

parameters.name: next_page_pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for paginating large result sets in host reports, with a 15-minute expiration.

value_schema.description: The next page token is used to paginate through large result sets. A next page token will be returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: zoom_group_id
parameters.description: The ID for the group. Use the List groups API to obtain this, as the response includes only users in the specified group.

value_schema.description:
The group ID. To get a group ID, use the [**List groups**](/docs/api/rest/reference/user/methods/#operation/groups) API. 

 **Note:** The API response will only contain users who are members of the queried group ID.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Zoom API.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Active or inactive hosts.  
 `active` - Active hosts.   
 `inactive` - Inactive hosts.

value_schema.description:
Active or inactive hosts.  
 `active` - Active hosts.   
 `inactive` - Inactive hosts.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format. The date range defined by the `from` and `to` parameters should only be one month as the report includes only one month worth of data at once.

value_schema.description: Start date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format. The date range defined by the `from` and `to` parameters should only be one month as the report includes only one month worth of data at once.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

value_schema.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The page number of the current page in the returned records.

value_schema.description: The page number of the current page in the returned records.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token is used to paginate through large result sets. A next page token will be returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

value_schema.description: The next page token is used to paginate through large result sets. A next page token will be returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description:
The group ID. To get a group ID, use the [**List groups**](/docs/api/rest/reference/user/methods/#operation/groups) API. 

 **Note:** The API response will only contain users who are members of the queried group ID.

value_schema.description:
The group ID. To get a group ID, use the [**List groups**](/docs/api/rest/reference/user/methods/#operation/groups) API.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
